Ive dropped watching anime and only catch up with trending anime casually. Got a recommendation from a friend and watching it cluelessly and slowly due to unclear plot. S1 leave me depressed and then I found out that there is S2. Straightaway watch it and already prepared my mind and soul for this season. But then ive been blessed to watch such beautiful moments in each eps with amazing characters which i hold dear in my heart. The characters are well written with brilliant development. We can see how much Lena grow as a warrior and glad she never loses her ideals and herself. As this season focus on shin as the protagonist, we could see well his point of views and how he overcome his conflicts after carrying all the burden over the past years. Two of my fav characters introduced in this season definitely are frederica and ernst. While frederica started off as kinda bit annoying character, she actually too wise for her age and her words could really penetrate shin's cold heart and made him find his reason to live and continue fighting. Ernst personality might made him looks like kinda shady with his ideals and all, but he truly stick by his ideals and performed his duty to the very best. Im glad that all the remaining characters survived and the spearhead squadron finally met their handler one. A beauty of masterpiece written and absolutely a gem for me. Bravo to all those who walk on this journey and reach up to this point. It could be an ending for some or even a beginning to something entirely new. May we meet again in the future fellow watchers. We wont forget!

After rewatching the ending many times, i noticed the subtle implication of the gravesite to Handler one. To her, she was shown what appears to be the gravesite of her fallen processors that went ahead of her, (left her behind), most of the team's broken mech(fast shot of the callsign insignia), Fido's prev body and the box of names and gravestone far from the republic. To her, she has finally arrived at the place where they had ended. Thats why she swore an oath to never forget them n left her version of their memory to show she's now at the same place as them.

Well also notice, she kept their "pictures". So she still believed they were alive. Her oath was more for the ones who already died. And she would have known they weren't among the dead because the monument had all the names of the dead 86, and the current team's names weren't on it.
